title: There are several good introductions to the philosophy of religion available. From a 4511
The Miracle of Theism
558 Appendix 1 and Robin Le Poidevin, Arguing for Atheism
surveys the main arguments in this area from a Christian perspective. Beverly and Brian Clack’s The Philosophy of Religion: A Critical Introduction
is another useful introduction. RIGHT AND WRONG James Rachel’s The Elements of Moral Philosophy
2003) is an excellent short introduction to ethics, as is Simon Blackburn’s Ethics: A Very Short Introduction
Richard Norman, The Moral Philosophers
provides a clear introduction to the major thinkers in this area. Jonathan Glover, Causing Death and Saving Lives
is a very useful guide to the application of critical thinking to ethical issues
